adjectives.description: monolithic (comparative more monolithic, superlative most monolithic)

entries.meaning: Consisting of a single chunk of hard material rather than an assembly of discrete parts.
examples: A monolithic chunk of titanium with facets for cutting, wrenching, and prying.

entries.meaning: (figurative) Having a massive, unchanging structure that does not permit individual variation.
examples: Mainstream culture is hardly the monolithic bloc that its caricaturization often implies.

entries.meaning: (figurative) Of a single structure, a singular component; instead of an assembly.
examples: Monolithic space stations only have a single station module.

entries.meaning: (software engineering) Consisting of a single program or codebase.
examples: Monolithic kernels perform all operating system duties in kernel space.
